creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile of large, silhouetted windmill, with a smaller windmill just behind; small wooden buildings down to L; sketchy, field like landscape in foreground; flock of birds ULQ; very dark image
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, Inscription

-- inscribed with publisher details in plate, below borderline: [Marchant r. de Rivoli, 140 / imp. Delâtre Paris]
-- in graphite at bottom of sheet: [Moulins, Montmartre, 1846 G98 III/III]
medium: Etching and aquatint on chine collé
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 17, 1983, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed, dated, and titled in plate, upper left: [Ch. Jacque 1846. Montmartre.]
title: Windmills, Montmartre
